content.description: To the left of the left facing corner is a short wall with thin holds. If you know what Willie McCovey's nick name was, you got the beta. A completely contrived line, but fun.
content.location: To the left of the left facing corner. The line goes with out using the crack, all face moves.

climbs.name: Warm Up Crack
climbs.fa: Ricky Miller, Ed Spear, JIm SMith, Ray Williams

content.description: The low angle crack in the corner to the left of the arete.
content.location: The most obvious crack at the crag, left of the arete. Chains at the top can hang down over the edge.

content.description: The left face of the prominent arete of the left facing corner on the wall. A difficult start leads to a seemingly blank section. Find the literal bullet hole to get you over this to the top. Too short to bolt, just a toprope.
content.location: The face to the left of the prominent arete of the left facing corner. Contrived, but do not cross the arete to the outside face.

climbs.name: The Other Crack
climbs.fa: Ricky Miller, Ed Spear, JIm Smith, Ray Williams

content.description: Dirty, grass filled, bush blocked crack about 30' to the right of The Crack. Ugh.

climbs.name: The Long Route
climbs.fa: Ricky Miller, Ed Spear, JIm Smith, Ray Williams

content.description: There are interesting options for this line which, although short and contrived, as are all the lines here, can be quite entertaining. Is it ironic that it is called the Long Route and only 40'? Only the FA knows for sure.
content.location: Slightly overhanging rails move to the right and up a fun face.

climbs.name: The Crack
climbs.fa: Ricky Miller, Ed Spear, JIm Smith, Ray Williams

content.description: Another one of those "if it was only longer" cracks. Even so, a fun line to do laps on, almost worth the drive just for this. Almost. Tape gloves recommended.
content.protection: A small amount of gear to 3".
content.location: The most prominent crack at the crag. Often needs to be cleaned as it is not often climbed.
